hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout Asymmetry
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a period of low volatility (BTC 20-day realized volatility < 30%) within a NEUTRAL regime, a breakout above the 20-day Bollinger Band (2 std) on expanding volume (>1.5x 20-day average) will lead to a sustained directional move with higher momentum continuation probability than a breakdown below the lower band.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In neutral regimes, prolonged low volatility often represents accumulation/consolidation. Breakouts on high volume from such compression tend to attract momentum flows as trapped positions are forced to react. Upside breakouts have shown stronger follow-through historically due to asymmetric positioning (more traders willing to chase rallies than sell-offs in neutral environments).
entry_conditions: BTC 20-day realized volatility < 30% for at least 5 consecutive days
BTC price closes > upper 20-day Bollinger Band (2 std)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price reaches 1.5x the Bollinger Band width (distance between upper and lower bands) measured from breakout close
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes back inside Bollinger Bands
exit_conditions.time_exit: 7 days after entry if neither TP nor SL hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If upside breakouts from low-vol neutral periods fail more than 55% of the time within 3 days (close back inside bands) OR if downside breakouts show equal or better momentum continuation.
